channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: How Mahmoud Khalil, a Columbia Student Activist, Landed in Federal Detention
item.description: Mahmoud Khalil never shielded his face with a mask the way some protesters did. That made him a target when President Trump decided to move aggressive...

item.title: Nita Lowey, Tenacious New York Representative, Dies at 87
item.description: A Democrat, she represented Westchester County for three decades and became the first woman to lead the powerful House Appropriations Committee.

item.title: Baidu releases reasoning AI model to take on DeepSeek
item.description: The Ernie X1 model by China’s internet search leader works similarly to DeepSeek R1.

item.title: Children Try to Cheer Pope Francis During His Hospital Stay
item.description: Dozens of young people gathered under the pontiff’s windows at the Gemelli hospital to offer wishes for a quick recovery.

item.title: Trump’s Moves Are Boosting Stocks … Overseas
item.description: For years, the S&P 500 soared above the stock indexes of other countries. But since Trump’s inauguration, it has fallen 6 percent and is now trailing ...

item.title: New Prime Minister Mark Carney vows Canada will ‘never, ever’ be part of the US as he seeks alliances in Europe
item.description: Carney has said he’s ready to meet with Trump if he shows respect for Canadian sovereignty.

item.title: SpaceX Capsule Docks in Space, Paving the Way for Astronauts’ Return
item.description: A SpaceX capsule docked at the International Space Station, bringing a replacement crew for Suni Williams and Butch Wilmore to return home after an un...

item.title: Houthis Vow Retaliation After U.S. Strikes in Yemen
item.description: The Iran-backed rebels, who have targeted Israel and shipping in the Red Sea, said children were among those killed in the strikes ordered by Presiden...

item.title: Wall Street’s recession odds are starting to look like a coin flip as Trump refuses to back down on his trade war
item.description: "If we would continue down this road of what would be more disruptive, business-unfriendly policies, I think the risks on that recession front would g...

item.title: China maps out plan to raise incomes and boost consumption
item.description: Other measures include stabilizing the stock and real estate markets, and offering incentives to raise the country’s birth rate.

item.title: Nightclub Fire Kills at Least 59 in North Macedonia
item.description: The tragedy occurred after fireworks set the club’s roof on fire during a pop concert, the country’s interior minister said.

item.title: Education Department staff cuts could limit options for families of kids with disabilities
item.description: Filing a complaint with the Education Department has long been an option for families who can't afford a lawyer.

item.title: Ukraine Retreats From Most of Russia’s Kursk Region
item.description: The daring campaign Ukraine launched last summer to seize and occupy Russian territory appears to be nearing an end.

item.title: East African Housekeepers Face Rape, Assault and Death in Saudi Arabia
item.description: East African leaders and Saudi royals are among those profiting off a lucrative, deadly trade in domestic workers.

item.title: Nightclub Fire Kills at Least 59 in North Macedonia
item.description: The tragedy occurred after fireworks set the club’s roof on fire during a pop concert, the country’s interior minister said.
